text: Preparing the Base of the Cocktail Pour the blue Curaçao and light gin together into a saucepan or heatproof container. Fill with about a quarter to a third of a glass of liquid. Stir the two liquids until both are completely mixed.  Heat up to just below boiling point.  Add the brown sugar while it's hot. Then remove from the heat and cool down rapidly by placing it into a freezer after heating. Transfer the frozen mixture to the highball glass. Pour the coconut milk and vermouth on top of the frozen mixture. Wait for it to thaw and combine on its own. Putting the Cocktail Together Prepare the ice in a cup while the other part of the cocktail is gently combining on its own. Add the tablespoons of simple syrup and grenadine to the cup. Mix the ice, syrup and grenadine in the blender. Blend until it forms a nice, smooth mixture with completely mixed ice. Add the ice portion to the cocktail until you have filled about half to two thirds of a glass.  Squeeze lemon on top for extra freshness.  Add sparkling water to fill.  Serving the Cocktail Garnish with a slice of pineapple and/or a single cherry.  Serve cold.  Enjoy!
